title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Marine Le Pen Falls to the Rule of Law and a Great Battle Looms
items.description: A court’s conviction of the far-right leader for embezzlement and its ban on her running for office have set off a new crisis for France.

items.title: Stocks set to post worst quarter in 3 years as investors wait in fear for ‘Liberation Day’

items.title: White House officials are considering a higher tax rate for the wealthiest Americans to help pay for cutting taxes on tips, report says
items.description: Ending taxes on tips was one of President Donald Trump's top campaign pledges, and he has reaffirmed it since returning to the White House.

items.title: A top forecaster sees the market bottoming as Wall Street raises recession forecasts over Trump tariffs
items.description: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Moody’s see an elevated chance of a recession this year on the back of tariffs and trade wars.

items.title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says almost everyone he talks to is ‘more anxious about the economy than any time in recent memory’
items.description: Fink’s letter comes as Wall Street recession odds spike over concerns of looming tariffs.

items.title: The way you brew your coffee can affect your heart health. Here’s the best method
items.description: Java contains cholesterol-elevating substances, called diterpenes, but the way you brew it can keep the levels low.
